author: Joe smith
comment: I have had this app for a few years. My issue is that there was never a way to show "track up" instead of north up.  I could be missing something? I mentioned this I my first review, (no longer shown) several  years ago and was told it wasn't an option. Why? Both my hand held GPS units support the track up option. This may not be an issue for others but i find it hard to believe lm the only one that would find this usefull. Be cause of this I don't use the app very much. Your mileage may vary

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: On the map page, press the menu button at top-rlight. Choose "Auto rotate on/off". This orients the map in the direction you are moving.

author: hedge mcnorry
comment: Used to work well. Last time i used it i found that it would not record distance travelled while screen is off (in my pocket). I walked 7km in flat open country with no trees, buildings or mountains around and it only recorded 384m as the distance travelled. There were no other apps that I'm aware of running in the background which might have also been using gps/cpu. Phone is a Samsung Galaxy S5.  Edit: Thanks for the suggestions, I did have a battery saving feature on. I will try that again without.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: It records long distances in my pocket fine for me on LG Nexus 5X running Oreo. Turn off battery optimisations for this app under your phone settings to see if that fixes the issue.

comment: I really like HandyGPS. On a work trip I carry equipment that is bulky & fiddly, weighs lots, and $100's of dollars. 2 hardware cameras, a GPS, cables, 2 compasses, a metal inclinometer. On days off HandyGPS is a really good Jack-of-all-trades that serves as well, and far lighter. Hardware capabilities vary with different phones, so I email Anthony with questions and he suggests workarounds. Lots of features - some of the criticisms I see in these reviews are from people who didn't look through all the options & menus. Hint - the phone's GPS eats battery (HandyGPS doesn't), so carry a portable phone charger.

author: Michael K. Adu-Yeboah
comment: Great as GPS handheld - Needs a modern interphase, and  ease of downloading offline maps and also the GoTo waypoint screen should be less laggy. It is avery useful a GPS app.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: If the goto screen is laggy, perhaps you have the power saving mode turned on under the general prefs in the app ? This reduces the GPS update rate from once a second to once every 5 seconds to save power. It is off by default because it does make things work a bit slower in the app, like the goto screen.

author: Amit Akiwate
comment: Can any one please tell how to import KMZ/KML files of google earth?

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: HandyGPS will import KML or GPX files only.  The import button is the folder button at the bottom left of the main page of the app. This will import files that you have copied to the HandyGPS folder on your phone's storage.

author: Damon Roy
comment: Not sure how to start a track on my LG Sport Watch?? 4stars... 5 when I figure it out... just not enough info on the watch part of this app. Help please... LG Sport/S 8+ AT&T

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content:
Once your watch has a GPS fix, the track will be logged.

If the LG watch does not have a built-in GPS, you will need to have the watch connected to your phone via BlueTooth to use the app.

 For more help about the watch app see the YouTube video on Handy GPS Wear: https://youtu.be/-zDJv4h1DnQ

author: Dwi Wahyu Wamenarno
comment: Nice GPS apps.... 👍👍

author: John Bulpitt
comment: Great software and getting better all the time, very diligent Dev.

author: David
comment: I bought the paid version on my old phone but when I upgraded my phone it didn't transfer across with all my other apps, now it wants me to pay again so I only have the free version now 😕

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: There are now three versions of HandyGPS on Google Play (free, subscription, and paid upfront). Make sure you try to re-install the same version that you previously had, using the same Google user ID and you should not be charged again. The version you want to install is now called "Handy GPS (paid upfront)".

author: Steven TREWIN
comment: Very good basic GPS app.  Great that does not require a data or cell connection and has UTM.  One of few also released on Windows.  Worth a few dollars for the paid version although the free version is well featured.

author: Justin Tallmon
comment: Love being able to place points in Google Earth and be able to bring them into Handy GPS. The dev is awesome!

author: Surya Prakash
comment: How to coordinates convert xls to kml file

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: HandyGPS does not read Excel spreadsheets, so you will need to find another way to convert such as https://www.earthpoint.us/ExcelToKml.aspx

author: Niklas Nikitin
comment: Everything I was looking for, great app.

author: Denis Paley
comment: Easy to use and great accuracy.

author: Forrest Smith
comment: Perfect.  I use the app on an older phone.  Love it.

author: Susan Pal
comment: This is an excellent app! Dev, is there a way we can create and/or edit a route with existing waypoints? I saved a few waypoints the other day but could not find a way to manually link them in a specific sequence. If this is not currently feasible, do you plan to add that feature in the near future? As mentioned above, I really like this app and if I could create routes, it would completely replace other apps I have. Thanks for a great app, dev! Update 11/28: Thank you for the quick reply, dev.  05/20: Thanks for the latest updates, dev! Which of the two methods for creating routes do you recommend? Can I use the same routing features if I use the original method (join)? I prefer that one since it allows me to save it.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: If you want to show waypoints joined as a tracklog, choose the first waypoint and select "join waypoints", then choose each other waypoint to join, and then press "done". But if you want to use the "Goto" page to follow a route between multiple waypoints, choose "make route" instead. See: http://www.binaryearth.net/HandyGPSHelp/RouteFollowing.html

author: Stephen Noble
comment: The real deal for finding co-ordinates

author: sridip saha
comment: As a Land surveyor this is one of the most useful app for me

author: Frank Brown
comment: This is an excellent app for playing in the brush. UPDATE 4/30/17: Thanks for the quick response. Deleting that folder worked perfectly.   Only complaint I have is that I can't change the Waypoint symbols. These haven't worked for several versions now.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: Custom waypoint symbols still work for me. If you haven't added any of your own symbol icons, you can manually delete the Symbols folder within the HandyGPS folder on your phone's storage. The app will then re-create the contents of this folder containing the standard symbols. Also see http://www.binaryearth.net/HandyGPSHelp/CustomSymbols.html

author: wissows saad
comment: amazing app

author: Kirby Richardson
comment: Like the app but have not been able to work with offline maps and that was the primary reason for purchasing the app. It says I have successfully downloaded the map but I can't pull it up to use it.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: I replied to your email.The trick is to make sure the URL and zoom levels, etc are correct using the "Test" button before downloading the maps. Even an extra space character in the URL can cause it to be invalid, and some tile servers do not support all zoom levels, so you may need to zoom out a bit.

author: Clicker Snapper
comment: It's Great! bought it! I have not found a better one to suite my needs.

author: Ken Baldwin
comment: It does what it does very well, but I would like to have more options while navigating to a waypoint. The compass is fine, but I'd like the option of navigating from the map screen (with a line to the destination) and a screen that gives you the distance to your destination, etc in text... sort of like the options on a Garmin GPS.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: Thanks for the idea. I've done one part of this in version 23.3. There is now an optional "goto line" on the map pages. If you turn this on via the map page menu, it draws an orange line between your location and your destination.

author: Bryn Dillard
comment: This app is brilliant for tracking your location and your route which it dusplays on the aerial photo map as you go.  On a couple of ocvasions Handy GPS has lead us straigjt back to car when we've been, er, debating the correct route. I'm anticipating a paid for version as it feels just wrong to use this excellent app for free!

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: You're actually reviewing the paid version of the app. The free version is more limited and is ad supported. Thanks.

author: Christopher Caldwell
comment: Ive used this for some time. It's getting better and I have enjoyed it. Most used features could be more prominent in interface and less used could move to secondary menu making more room on phone screen. Very well done!

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. In version 24.0, the main page menu has been re-organized into several sub-menus, with the most important things at the top level.

comment: Die App ist Super. Ich nutze sie schon seit Jahren. :D Danke für so was Gutes und danke für ständige Verbesserungen. :) Weiter so. :3

author: Brenda Harney
comment: This app has been very helpful! I Love it! Thank you!

author: Brian Barnes
comment: Great app for doing geological field work. Have used for marking out geophysical survey lines. Developers are supportive to help work through problems. Great value for money
I like the ability to download tiles for offline, it makes it a lot nicer when your on a long hike in the boonies.

author: Marco Hoffmann
comment: Using the app for navigating on my motorbike in the bush, it does everything it needs to do perfectly well.

author: Don R
comment: Great app for those that trail ride on horses.

author: James Austin
comment: Very hard to use. Geeky terms. No layman instructions. Awful interface. How do I make a quick easy record of my hike?

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: No set up is required to record your hike other than to make sure the GPS is turned on. I have simplified the geek-speek in the store listing. Watch the video at the top of the Google Play store listing or press the "?" button in the app for help. The app probably does more than you need. A simpler track logging app might suit you better.

author: Herman P
comment: I love it. It is very feature rich and takes therefore a bit of getting used to it. I use it almost every weekend to record my hikes.

author: Tutur P. Purbosayekti
comment: Good

author: Sompong Pimpileuk
comment: Useful

author: Reizod Dozier
comment: I've used this for years and its great!

author: Anderson Kemper
comment: The best GPS app. Just perfect
title: Awesome

author: Hernan Ugalde
comment: Lots of very good features for real navigation and survey planning.
title: Awesome gps app!

author: Gene Barnes
comment: Great app.. Would like to see the compas needle to be bigger and in red so I can see it better while walking.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: Thanks for the feedback. There was no needle on the compass page, but I have added one now.

title: Gene Barnes

author: Robert Lillis
comment: Love this for tracking where I have been only thing I would love to see (unless I have missed it) is a way to pause the tracking distance so when I'm out walking and go back home I can pause it then turn it back on when you go back out.

reply.author: BinaryEarth
reply.content: Thanks! There is currently no way to pause the odometer. But if you exit app it will stop updating. However, you can pause track logging in the app. There is a pause/play button on the extended toolbar (second from right). This pauses track log recording. You can see total distance for the tracklog using the "i" button and pressing "More".

title: Best GPS map I've used on my phone
